p: Since the beginning of humanity, plants have been used as the main resources of foods, medicines, clothing, and other goods [ 1]. Many pharmaceutical drugs are derived from plant resources with potent biological activities, along with the low side effects and costs [ 2]. There are more than 250,000 identified plant species worldwide; among them, 7000 species are cultivated plants that are used in various human activities [ 3] to provide a myriad of bioactive components, i.e., dietary fiber, minerals, vitamins, and diverse amounts of phytochemicals or secondary metabolites [ 4].
